Description: A terracotta figure of a cat half-seated to right, its face to front, with a broad collar round the neck. The back is plain. Apparently solid; one-piece mould, the rear hand-modelled; details of collar and tail retouched. Orange-brown clay, probably a Nile silt, with a darker brown surface. Very low-fired.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Mrs Thomas Cook. Not ancient: the fabric is close to that of products of a workshop that flourished from at least as early as 1910, perhaps continuing up until the Second World War (see the Upper Egypt Group in Bailey 1988: 441-2: lamps, shabtis, large scarabs and other objects were made).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3715)
